review: We did the Miami City Tour with our kids, and it was fantastic! The guide was so friendly and kept our children entertained while still giving us plenty of history and local knowledge. The Miami Seaquarium was the highlight for the kids, and the Bayside Marketplace had lots of shops for us adults to enjoy. It was a great family day out!

The Telluride & Vail Tour was beautiful, but it felt a bit rushed. Both towns have so much to offer, but with only a limited amount of time in each, it was hard to fully explore. That said, the skiing was fantastic, and the stops for shopping and sightseeing were excellent. It’s a great way to get a quick taste of these two amazing towns if you're short on time.

This tour was packed with a lot of highlights! We saw everything from the Empire State Building to Broadway. However, it felt a bit rushed at times. I would have liked more time in places like Central Park or 5th Avenue, but the guide kept the energy high and shared lots of fun facts. For someone who wants to get a quick overview of the city, this is a great option!

If you're a foodie, Chicago is the place to be! The deep-dish pizza at Lou Malnati’s was incredible, and we also had the best Chicago-style hot dogs in Portillo’s. Aside from the food, the city has a ton to offer in terms of sightseeing, from the stunning views at Navy Pier to the amazing exhibits at the Field Museum. We also took a boat tour on the Chicago River, which provided a great perspective on the city’s architecture.

I loved the energy of Chicago! It’s a great mix of big city excitement and outdoor beauty. We enjoyed walking along the Magnificent Mile, taking in the shops and dining, and spent time at the Museum of Science and Industry and Lincoln Park Zoo. The only downside was that we didn’t have enough time to see everything we wanted, so I’ll definitely be back for another visit.

If you’re an outdoor enthusiast, this Texas road trip is for you! Big Bend was amazing for hiking and exploring the desert, while Carlsbad Caverns gave us a chance to explore vast underground caverns. We also loved hiking in the Guadalupe Mountains, which offered stunning views of the desert below. The highlight for me was White Sands, which felt like stepping onto another planet. My only wish was that we had more time at each location to really take it all in.

The Los Angeles to San Francisco road trip was a once-in-a-lifetime experience! The drive was stunning, with breathtaking views of the Pacific Coast Highway and iconic spots like Santa Barbara, Big Sur, and Monterey. We took a break in San Luis Obispo, explored the Hearst Castle, and ended our trip with the amazing views of the Golden Gate Bridge. It’s a perfect blend of natural beauty, culture, and adventure!

This tour is perfect for first-timers. We covered all the major attractions like South Beach, Little Havana, and Wynwood Walls. The guide was knowledgeable, and the bus was comfortable. The only downside was that we didn’t have enough time to explore Wynwood fully, but overall it was a great introduction to the city.

The Rocky Mountain Tour was absolutely incredible! The views from Rocky Mountain National Park were beyond anything I expected—majestic mountain peaks, crystal-clear lakes, and abundant wildlife. The tour guide was very knowledgeable and made sure to point out all the must-see spots. The Trail Ridge Road drive was especially breathtaking! Definitely a must-do for nature lovers.

We did this tour as a family, and it was perfect! The skiing in Telluride is fantastic for beginners, and the town itself is charming and easy to navigate. Vail was a bit more challenging in terms of skiing, but there were plenty of beginner-friendly slopes for everyone to enjoy. The family-friendly atmosphere and knowledgeable guides made the tour enjoyable for all ages. Highly recommend it!

This tour was ideal for those who love the nightlife! We hit up some of the best nightclubs and visited places like Omnia and Hakkasan. It was a great way to skip the lines and get straight to the fun. The Las Vegas Strip at night is something you need to see for yourself—it’s incredible. Perfect for anyone who wants to dive straight into the Vegas party scene.

The Los Angeles to San Diego road trip was everything I hoped for and more! We had stunning coastal views along the way, especially as we passed through Laguna Beach and Dana Point. The stops in La Jolla and Coronado were fantastic, offering beautiful beaches and charming neighborhoods. It’s the perfect combination of sightseeing, relaxation, and adventure. Highly recommend this trip for anyone who loves a scenic drive!

This road trip offers some of the most dramatic and stunning landscapes in the U.S. Big Bend National Park was an incredible place to hike, and the Guadalupe Mountains were perfect for taking in panoramic views of West Texas. Carlsbad Caverns felt like entering another world, and White Sands National Park offered surreal and beautiful views of the massive sand dunes. If you love nature, this is the road trip for you!

If you love hiking, the Rocky Mountain Tour is perfect for you. We had the opportunity to do some moderate trails and saw beautiful alpine meadows, waterfalls, and wildlife. The only downside was the weather—it can get unpredictable in the mountains, so be prepared for sudden changes. Still, the tour was well-organized, and I would highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys outdoor adventures

While Telluride and Vail are both incredible places, I felt like we didn’t have enough time to really enjoy everything. Telluride offers a much quieter vibe, and the skiing is superb, but it would have been great to spend a little more time there. Vail, on the other hand, is more commercialized and has a bustling vibe, but we barely scratched the surface in both towns. Great trip overall, but would have loved more time in each location.

The Las Vegas Tour was a whirlwind of excitement and entertainment! From visiting the iconic Las Vegas Strip with its grand hotels and dazzling lights to experiencing world-class shows and amazing cuisine, every moment was unforgettable. The highlight of our tour was definitely the Fountains of Bellagio show and a visit to a Michelin-starred restaurant. Highly recommend this tour for anyone looking to experience the best of Las Vegas in one go!

This New York City Tour was the perfect way to experience the city for the first time. We saw all the iconic landmarks, including Times Square, Central Park, and the Statue of Liberty. The tour was well-organized, and the guide gave us interesting facts about each location. We had enough time at each stop to take photos and explore, but not too much that we felt rushed. A must-do for any first-time visitor to New York!

Chicago exceeded my expectations! We spent a lot of time in Millennium Park and took in the views from the Skydeck Chicago at the Willis Tower. The Navy Pier was perfect for a relaxed afternoon, and we took a fun boat tour of the river. The nightlife was also fantastic—great bars, music, and places to dance. If you're looking for a city that has something for everyone, Chicago is a great choice.

I didn’t expect Chicago to be so green! We had a lovely time walking through Grant Park and Lincoln Park, and the zoo was a fun stop too. Of course, we explored the city’s iconic landmarks like The Bean and the Chicago Riverwalk, but I was pleasantly surprised by how many parks and green spaces the city had. It made for a nice balance between urban excitement and nature.

While the drive from Los Angeles to San Francisco was absolutely beautiful, it did feel a bit long at times. The stops along the way, like Santa Barbara, Pismo Beach, and Big Sur, were incredible, with gorgeous coastal views and charming towns. I would suggest breaking the trip into two days to fully enjoy each location, as it can be tiring if you’re trying to do it all in one go.

I absolutely loved this California road trip! The drive along Pacific Coast Highway was absolutely breathtaking, and there were so many great spots to stop at for photos. We visited Santa Monica Pier, enjoyed the sights in Venice Beach, and then continued on to La Jolla for some amazing coastal views. The trip from Los Angeles to San Diego felt like a perfect balance of fun and relaxation, and we enjoyed delicious food along the way. Perfect day trip!

I really enjoyed the tour—it covered so much ground in a short amount of time! We visited Empire State Building, 5th Avenue, and even got a chance to stroll through Central Park. The guide was knowledgeable and pointed out little details about the city that I wouldn’t have noticed otherwise. It did feel a bit fast-paced, especially when we were walking around, but overall it was a great way to see the city in a single day.

What a trip! The Rocky Mountains are absolutely stunning, and our guide made sure we didn’t miss any of the key spots. From Bear Lake to Alpine Visitor Center, everything was breathtaking. Be warned though—the weather can change quickly, so make sure you bring plenty of layers! It was chilly at the higher altitudes, but the experience was worth it.

I absolutely loved this tour! We explored so many of Miami's vibrant neighborhoods, and the stops were perfectly planned. Vizcaya Museum was stunning, and Bayside Marketplace was great for shopping. The highlight was definitely the visit to Little Havana—so much culture in one place. Would highly recommend this to anyone visiting Miami!

I did the Rocky Mountain Tour with my family, and it was an unforgettable experience. The kids loved spotting elk and other wildlife, and the scenic drives were stunning. The guide was very engaging and made the history of the park fun for all ages. There were stops for easy walks, so everyone could enjoy the views, regardless of age or fitness level.

This tour was amazing! We went to all the iconic spots: Times Square, Brooklyn Bridge, and Top of the Rock. Our guide gave us lots of great recommendations for restaurants and things to do outside of the tour, too. If you only have a day or two in the city, this is the best way to make sure you hit all the big landmarks.

This trip took us along the most scenic route I’ve ever driven! We made stops at Santa Barbara for wine tasting, San Luis Obispo for some local culture, and the famous Bixby Creek Bridge for a great photo op. The drive along Big Sur was absolutely jaw-dropping, and we ended the day with a visit to Monterey Bay Aquarium before heading to San Francisco. I highly recommend this road trip for anyone who enjoys beautiful landscapes and quirky towns.

I’ve been on many road trips, but this one through Texas stands out for its unique blend of natural beauty. Big Bend was perfect for stargazing and wildlife spotting, while Carlsbad Caverns left me in awe with its incredible underground formations. Guadalupe Mountains gave us the chance to hike to some of the highest points in Texas, and White Sands was truly otherworldly. It’s a trip that offers everything—hiking, sightseeing, and exploration.

This tour is an ideal way to see the highlights of Miami in one day. It was quick, but packed with amazing stops, from the beach to museums. If you’re short on time, this is definitely the way to go. The only reason I’m giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is because we didn’t get enough time at the Miami Seaquarium.

The Rocky Mountain Tour was gorgeous and a great way to see the best parts of the national park. My only complaint was that we didn’t have enough time to fully explore some of the hikes, like those around Bear Lake. The tour is a bit fast-paced, and I would have loved to spend more time at some of the more scenic spots.

This Telluride & Vail Tour was incredible! Both towns are gorgeous, with Telluride offering that charming, historic vibe and Vail providing a more luxurious, high-end atmosphere. Telluride has amazing skiing and après-ski, and Vail is perfect for those who love shopping, fine dining, and hitting the slopes. The tour guide was super knowledgeable about both locations, making the experience even better. Highly recommend it for any ski or outdoor enthusiast!

This tour is great for first-time visitors who want to see all the highlights. We explored the Fremont Street Experience, saw the Welcome to Las Vegas Sign, and even got a chance to visit some of the biggest casinos. It was a little fast-paced, and I would have liked more time at each spot, but overall, it was a fun and exciting way to discover the city. Definitely a must-do if you’re short on time.

This road trip offered an excellent mix of city sights and natural beauty. We started in Los Angeles with a quick stop at Hollywood Boulevard and Griffith Park, then headed south to Laguna Beach and Mission San Juan Capistrano. Once in San Diego, we explored Old Town and had a blast at Balboa Park. The variety of attractions made this a perfect tour for all interests—culture, nature, and history

If you love nature, this road trip from Los Angeles to San Francisco is a must-do! We hiked in Pfeiffer Big Sur State Park, enjoyed the dramatic cliffs and coastline, and stopped at Point Lobos State Reserve for stunning views of the Pacific. I loved that the route took us through Big Sur and the Mendocino Coast, where you feel like you’re truly immersed in the wild beauty of California. This tour is perfect for anyone who enjoys outdoor adventures.

I came to Chicago for a weekend, and it was perfect! We took the Chicago Architecture Boat Tour, which was a fantastic way to learn about the city’s iconic buildings. We spent some time at the Art Institute, and then hit up Millennium Park for photos by the Bean. The city is so walkable, and we had such a great time exploring the neighborhoods. Plus, the food was amazing! I’d definitely come back.

This Texas road trip was perfect for history and nature lovers. We visited the historic Chisos Mountains and learned about the region’s Native American and Spanish history. Carlsbad Caverns provided a deeper look into the earth’s history, with incredible limestone formations. The Guadalupe Mountains offered a mix of history and stunning geological formations, and White Sands was the cherry on top—an awe-inspiring natural wonder!

As someone who loves the beach, this Los Angeles to San Diego road trip was absolutely perfect! We started the trip in Venice Beach, then made our way down to Santa Monica and stopped at the beautiful beaches along Malibu. La Jolla in San Diego was another highlight, with its stunning coastline and sea lions. Every stop along the way offered something unique, and we had the opportunity to explore a variety of beaches, from surf spots to serene coves.!

If you love photography, this tour is a dream come true. From the emerald waters of Bear Lake to the towering mountain peaks, there were endless opportunities for breathtaking photos. Our guide also shared great tips on capturing the perfect shot. Highly recommend this tour to anyone who wants to capture the raw beauty of the Rocky Mountains!

I had an amazing time exploring Miami’s cultural landmarks. The guide was passionate about the history, and it was clear they loved sharing their knowledge of the city's diverse neighborhoods. South Beach was stunning, and the visit to Little Havana was full of energy, music, and delicious Cuban food!

Both Telluride and Vail are stunning, and the views alone were worth the trip. Telluride offers a more laid-back and scenic experience, while Vail has a bigger, bustling ski scene. The only downside was the weather on one of the days, which limited skiing, but the tour still made up for it with scenic drives and cozy stops. It’s definitely a must-do for skiers looking for a two-town experience!

If you're looking for luxury, this tour is fantastic. We got to visit some of Las Vegas's most glamorous resorts, including The Venetian, Caesars Palace, and The Bellagio, and even had time for a Michelin-starred dinner. The tour guide was excellent and gave us insider tips on how to make the most of our time in Vegas. It was a classy and well-organized way to see the best of what Las Vegas has to offer.

We had an amazing time on this Los Angeles to San Diego road trip, but it felt a bit rushed at times. We visited Venice Beach, Laguna Beach, and Old Town San Diego, all in one day, which was a lot to fit in. The drive along Pacific Coast Highway was beautiful, but I would have loved more time to stop and explore some of the smaller towns like Dana Point or Carlsbad. Still, it was a great trip and a fantastic way to see a lot in a short amount of time.!

While this Texas road trip was absolutely stunning, it’s definitely a long drive between some of the locations. The drive from Big Bend to Carlsbad Caverns took several hours, and the road to White Sands felt like it went on forever. However, the rewards of seeing such unique locations like White Sands and Guadalupe Mountains made it all worth it. If you don’t mind long stretches of driving, you’ll be rewarded with unforgettable sights.

We were lucky enough to see a lot of wildlife on our Rocky Mountain Tour—from elk grazing in the meadows to a family of mule deer by the road. The guide was very knowledgeable about the wildlife, and we learned a lot about the animals and their habitats. If you're into wildlife watching, this is definitely a tour you shouldn’t miss.

I loved that this tour combined outdoor adventure with a taste of local culture. Telluride is a historic gem with its old mining town charm and beautiful mountain views. Then, we went to Vail, where you get the upscale ski resort vibe with excellent dining and shopping. The tour allowed time for both skiing and exploring each town’s unique character. A perfect trip for anyone who loves a good combination of history, culture, and skiing.

If you love shows, this tour is perfect! We had the opportunity to see some of the top shows in the city, including a Cirque du Soleil performance and a live music event. The night tour of The Strip was also amazing, with all the lights and attractions. There’s so much to see and do in Las Vegas, and this tour really packs in the best entertainment options.

I’m a big history lover, and this New York City Tour did not disappoint! We spent time in Lower Manhattan, learning about the 9/11 Memorial and the Statue of Liberty. Our guide was incredibly knowledgeable about the history of New York and gave us tons of interesting tidbits. I especially appreciated the visit to Ellis Island, which was really moving. Highly recommend this tour for anyone interested in learning about the city’s past.

This California road trip was exactly what I needed for a weekend getaway. We had a chance to see the best parts of Los Angeles and San Diego, from the hustle and bustle of Hollywood to the laid-back vibes of La Jolla. Along the way, we stopped in some beautiful beach towns like Laguna Beach and Dana Point. It was a great way to relax and experience the diversity of Southern California.

The Los Angeles to San Francisco road trip is the ultimate coastal drive! We started by visiting Santa Monica, then made our way to Santa Barbara, and continued north along the Pacific Coast Highway. Big Sur and Hearst Castle were some of the highlights. The Golden Gate Bridge was the perfect way to end the trip. It’s the best way to see the true beauty of California’s coastline. Highly recommend this route!

I had such an amazing time in Chicago! The city has everything—from stunning architecture like the Willis Tower and John Hancock Center to cultural gems like the Art Institute of Chicago. I also loved walking along Millennium Park and seeing the famous Cloud Gate (The Bean). The food in Chicago is a standout—deep-dish pizza and Chicago-style hot dogs are a must! Highly recommend this trip for anyone looking for a blend of culture, food, and fun.

While the tour covered a lot of Miami’s iconic spots, I felt a little rushed at each stop. We barely had time to grab a coffee in Coconut Grove or explore the Art Deco district in South Beach. It was a nice taste of Miami, but I’d recommend planning a longer stay in some of these places if you’re really interested.

The Rocky Mountain Tour was beautiful, but as someone who had never been in the mountains before, it was a bit overwhelming. Some of the elevation changes affected my energy levels, and the weather was a little unpredictable. However, the tour was well-run, and the views are absolutely worth it. If you’re new to mountain tours, be prepared for the altitude and physical challenges.

The food part of the tour was fantastic! We got to dine at a Michelin-starred restaurant, and the meal was beyond delicious. However, I felt a little rushed with the sightseeing portions. We had time to visit Fremont Street and the Stratosphere, but it was a bit limited. A bit more time for sightseeing would have made it perfect. That said, the food and entertainment definitely made it a memorable experience.

This was an unforgettable road trip. The drive from Los Angeles to San Francisco takes you through so many iconic spots, from Santa Barbara’s wine country to Hearst Castle. We also stopped at quirky towns like San Luis Obispo and explored the Carmel-by-the-Sea area, which is filled with galleries and unique boutiques. Once we reached San Francisco, we had time to explore Golden Gate Park and the Fisherman’s Wharf area. A great combination of nature, history, and culture!

This Texas road trip was an unforgettable adventure! From the majestic mountains and desert landscapes of Big Bend to the awe-inspiring caves at Carlsbad Caverns, every stop had something unique to offer. We also hiked the rugged trails of the Guadalupe Mountains and marveled at the vastness of White Sands National Park. The combination of diverse landscapes made this one of the best road trips I’ve ever done!

This road trip was the perfect mix of scenic beauty and outdoor adventure. We started at Big Bend, exploring the Chisos Mountains and the Rio Grande, and then ventured to Carlsbad Caverns, where the underground world was just breathtaking. The Guadalupe Mountains offered some of the best hiking views I’ve ever seen, and White Sands National Park was unlike anything I expected—pure white dunes as far as the eye could see. A truly diverse and beautiful trip through Texas and beyond!

As an art lover, Chicago was a dream come true. The Art Institute had an incredible collection, and the architecture tour along the river was fascinating. We learned so much about the city’s design and history. Don’t miss the Chicago Architecture Foundation tour! Also, the Millennium Park is a lovely spot to relax and enjoy the outdoors. It was an unforgettable trip.

Las Vegas is all about excitement, and this tour definitely delivered! From the lights on The Strip to visiting the Luxor and MGM Grand, it was high-energy the whole way through. We even got to do a little gambling at the Casino Royale, which was a fun experience. The tour guide kept the pace up, ensuring we hit all the big spots in one day. A fun-packed way to experience the city!

This tour had the perfect balance of active adventure and relaxing scenic drives. The hikes were short and manageable, but offered stunning views of lakes and waterfalls. The drives through the park were incredible, especially along Trail Ridge Road, where we reached over 12,000 feet above sea level! The tour was an excellent mix of outdoor adventure and laid-back sightseeing.

Hands down, the best coastal road trip I’ve been on! The drive from Los Angeles to San Diego was stunning, with panoramic views of the ocean at almost every turn. We made stops at Santa Monica, Malibu, and Coronado, and I was blown away by the beauty at each stop. The San Diego Zoo and Balboa Park were great additions once we reached the city. This is the perfect trip for anyone who loves the coast!
